summary.span: 表示对 或 可以包含的所有元素的事件和布局进行管理的抽象基类。

span.span: Represents the abstract base class that manages events and layout for all the elements that a or can contain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A是一个元素，如按钮、 组合框、 文本框中或中可包含的标签控件或控件，类似于 Windows 快捷菜单。A is an element such as a button, combo box, text box, or label that can be contained in a control or a control, which is similar to a Windows shortcut menu. 类管理绘制、 键盘和鼠标输入，包括拖放的这些元素中，输入与类管理事件和在其自身的元素中的布局。The class manages the painting and keyboard and mouse input, including drag-and-drop input, for these elements, and the class manages events and layout within the elements themselves. 请从直接继承的类，或它们间接继承自通过或。 classes either inherit directly from , or they inherit indirectly from through or . 控件必须包含在， ， ，或和不能直接添加到窗体。 controls must be contained in a , , , or and cannot be added directly to a form. 各种容器类被设计为包含的相应子集控件。The various container classes are designed to contain an appropriate subset of controls. **请注意**给定不能有多个父。**Note** A given cannot have more than one parent . 你必须将复制的并将其添加到其他控件。You must copy of the and add it to other controls. 下表显示派生自元素类和因此可以承载于或。The following table shows the elements that derive from the class and which therefore can be hosted in a or . |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| ||支持图像和文本的工具栏按钮。A toolbar button that supports images and text.| ||通常在状态栏中使用的文本标签或作为注释或标题。A text label typically used in a status bar or as a comment or title.| ||非可选空格或以直观地对元素进行分组的垂直条的空间。A non-selectable space or space with a vertical bar that visually groups elements.| ||A承载， ， ，其他 Windows 窗体控件或自定义控件。A that hosts a , , , other Windows Forms controls, or custom controls.

A一个文本框，用户可以在其中输入文本，以及用户可以从中选择的文本以填充文本框中的列表。A is a text box in which the user can enter text, along with a list from which the user can select text to fill the text box.

A使用户能够输入文本。A enables the user to enter text.

A表示 Windows 进度栏控件中包含。A represents a Windows progress bar control contained in a .| ||A承载， ，和。A that hosts a , , and .

A是菜单或上下文菜单上显示的可选选项。A is a selectable option displayed on a menu or context menu.

A是常规按钮和一个下拉列表按钮的组合。A is a combination of a regular button and a drop-down button.

A是支持下拉菜单的功能的按钮。A is a button that supports drop-down functionality.| ||中的一个面板控件。A panel in a control.| ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何实现一个自定义控件。The following code example demonstrates how to implement a custom control. remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象的属性描述对象的主要方法从用户的角度来看的操作。An object's property describes the object's primary method of manipulation from the user's viewpoint. 此属性应为一个谓词或谓词短语。This property should be a verb or a short verb phrase. > [!NOTE] > 并非所有对象都有默认操作，而某些对象可能都具有与相关的默认操作其属性，例如，下面的示例：Not all objects have default actions, and some objects might have a default action that is related to its property, such as in the following examples: - 选中的复选框，并且在"请先取消选中"默认操作的值为"已选中"。A selected check box has a default action of "Uncheck" and a value of "Checked." - 已清除的复选框还具有默认操作的"检查"和"未选中。"的值A cleared check box has a default action of "Check" and a value of "Unchecked." - 标记的按钮**打印**"Press，"默认操作具有任何值。A button labeled **Print** has a default action of "Press," with no value. - 标签或文本框控件显示**打印机**没有默认操作，但"打印机。"的值A label or a text box control that shows **Printer** has no default action, but would have a value of "Printer." 有关辅助性对象的属性的详细信息，请参阅"内容的描述性属性"的"Active Accessibility"部分中的 MSDN 库中，在http://msdn.microsoft.com/library。For more information about properties of accessible objects, see "Content of Descriptive Properties" in the "Active Accessibility" section of the MSDN Library, at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library. 有关示例，请参阅类。For samples, see the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象的属性提供有关对象的可视外观的文本说明。An object's property provides a textual description about an object's visual appearance. 描述主要用于提供更大的上下文对于视力较差或盲人用户，但还可用于上下文搜索或其他应用程序。The description is primarily used to provide greater context for low-vision or blind users, but can also be used for context searching or other applications. 属性是描述不是很明显，如果需要或如果它不是冗余基于对象的， ， ，和属性。The property is needed if the description is not obvious, or if it is not redundant based on the object's , , , and properties. 例如，标记的按钮**确定**将不需要其他信息，但会显示的兰图片的按钮。For example, a button labeled **OK** would not need additional information, but a button that shows a picture of a cactus would. 和和可能兰按钮的属性将描述其用途，但属性传达不太明确，例如"显示图片的兰的按钮。"的信息The and and, perhaps, properties for the cactus button would describe its purpose, but the property would convey information that is less tangible, such as "A button that shows a picture of a cactus." 有关辅助性对象的属性的详细信息，请参阅"内容的描述性属性"的"Active Accessibility"部分中的 MSDN 库中，在http://msdn.microsoft.com/library。For more information about properties of accessible objects, see "Content of Descriptive Properties" in the "Active Accessibility" section of the MSDN Library, at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library. 有关示例，请参阅类。For samples, see the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来定义如何调整其父控件的大小时是否自动调整大小。Use the property to define how a is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. 锚定到其父控件的控件，可确保时调整父控件的锚定的边缘保留在父控件的同一位置相对于边缘。Anchoring a control to its parent control ensures that the anchored edges remain in the same position relative to the edges of the parent control when the parent control is resized. > [!NOTE] > 和属性是互相排斥。The and properties are mutually exclusive. 只有一个可以设置一次和最后一个组将优先。Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件传递给其事件处理程序中，因此它仅指示发生了单击操作。The event passes an to its event handler, so it only indicates that a click has occurred. 如果需要更具体的鼠标信息 （按钮、 单击、 鼠标轮旋转或位置的数），使用和传递事件到事件处理程序。If you need more specific mouse information (button, number of clicks, wheel rotation, or location), use the and events which pass a to the event handler. 由用户的操作系统的鼠标设置确定一次双击。A double-click is determined by the mouse settings of the user's operating system. 用户可以设置两次单击鼠标按钮之间的时间以便将这两次单击认为是双击而不是两次单击。The user can set the time between clicks of a mouse button that should be considered a double-click rather than two clicks. 每次双击控件时引发事件。The event is raised every time a control is double-clicked. 例如，如果你有两个事件处理程序和的事件、和双击窗体，这两种方法调用时将引发事件。For example, if you have two event handlers for the and events of a , the and events are raised when the form is double-clicked and both methods are called. 如果项是双击，不支持事件，事件，可能会引发两次。If an item is double-clicked that does not support the event, the event might be raised twice. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何设置， ，和属性以及如何处理事件。The following code example demonstrates how to set the , , and properties, and handle the event. 若要运行此示例，请将以下代码粘贴到一个包含窗体名为`movingToolStrip`并调用`InitializeMovingToolStrip`窗体的构造函数中或`Load`事件处理程序。To run this example, paste the following code into a form that contains a named `movingToolStrip` and call `InitializeMovingToolStrip` in the form's constructor or `Load` event handler. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性仅适用于流布局。This property applies only to flow layouts. 使用属性来定义如何调整其父控件的大小时是否自动调整大小。Use the property to define how a is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. 例如，设置到导致将其自身对齐其父控件的左边缘和根据父控件一起调整大小调整大小。For example, setting to causes the to align itself with the left edges of its parent control and to resize as the parent control is resized. 控件停靠在其 Z 顺序，即沿窗体的 z 轴 （深度） 窗体上控件的可视化分层。Controls are docked in their Z-order, which is the visual layering of controls on a form along the form's Z-axis (depth). 控件可以停靠到其父容器的一个边或可以停靠到所有边缘和填充的父容器。A control can be docked to one edge of its parent container or can be docked to all edges and fill the parent container. > [!NOTE] > 和属性是互相排斥。The and properties are mutually exclusive. 只有一个可以设置一次和最后一个组将优先。Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 由用户的操作系统的鼠标设置确定一次双击。A double-click is determined by the mouse settings of the user's operating system. 用户可以设置两次单击鼠标按钮之间的时间以便将这两次单击认为是双击而不是两次单击。The user can set the time between clicks of a mouse button that should be considered a double-click rather than two clicks. 每次双击控件时引发事件。The event is raised every time a control is double-clicked. 例如，如果你有两个事件处理程序和的事件、和双击窗体，这两种方法调用时将引发事件。For example, if you have two event handlers for the and events of a , the and events are raised when the form is double-clicked and both methods are called. 如果项是双击，不支持事件，事件，可能会引发两次。If an item is double-clicked that does not support the event, the event might be raised twice. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在示例中，事件处理程序报告的匹配项事件。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报告可帮助您了解当发生事件，并可以帮助您进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告或频繁发生的事件上多个事件，请考虑替换与或追加到一个多行消息。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行此代码示例，请将其粘贴到包含从继承的类型的实例的项目，如或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后将其命名实例`ToolStripItem1`并确保与事件处理程序事件。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. span.span: Occurs when the user drags an item into the client area of this item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 用户拖放操作过程中首次将鼠标光标拖到项时将引发事件。The event is raised when the user first drags the mouse cursor over the item during a drag-and-drop operation. 下面的备注描述如何以及何时引发与拖放操作相关的事件。The following remarks describe how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised. 方法确定当前光标位置下的项。The method determines the item under the current cursor location. 然后检查以查看项是否为有效的放置目标。It then checks to see if the item is a valid drop target. 如果项是有效的放置目标，产生指定的拖放效果引发事件。If the item is a valid drop target, the event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified. 有关拖放效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the enumeration. 按以下方式跟踪的更改的鼠标光标位置、 键盘状态和鼠标按钮状态：Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked in the following manner: - 如果用户移出一个窗口，则引发 事件。If the user moves out of a window, the event is raised. - 如果鼠标进入另一个项，引发该控件。If the mouse enters another item, the for that control is raised. - 如果鼠标移动但停留在同一个项，引发事件。If the mouse moves but stays within the same item, the event is raised. 如果键盘或鼠标按钮状态，更改事件引发，并确定是否继续拖动、 放置数据或取消该操作基于值属性的事件的。If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the property of the event's . 如果值是、引发事件以继续操作和产生新效果引发事件，从而能够设置适当的视觉反馈。If the value of is , the event is raised to continue the operation and the event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set. 有关有效放置效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of valid drop effects, see the enumeration. 和事件成对发生，以便当鼠标移到放置目标时，用户提供的最新反馈有关鼠标位置，如下所示：The and events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse's position, as follows: - 如果值是、 向源返回放置效果值，以便源应用程序可以执行适当的操作的源数据; 例如，如果会剪切数据是移动操作。If the value of is , the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果值是、引发事件。If the value of is , the event is raised. > [!NOTE] > 和属性位于屏幕坐标，未工作区坐标。The and properties of the are in screen coordinates, not client coordinates. 有关处理事件的详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将转换和属性设置为客户端。The following code example shows how to convert the and properties to a client . 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. 例如，如果会剪切数据是移动操作。If the value of is , the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果值是、引发事件。If the value of is , the event is raised. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在示例中，事件处理程序报告的匹配项事件。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报告可帮助您了解当发生事件，并可以帮助您进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告或频繁发生的事件上多个事件，请考虑替换与或追加到一个多行消息。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行此代码示例，请将其粘贴到包含从继承的类型的实例的项目，如或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后将其命名实例`ToolStripItem1`并确保与事件处理程序事件。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. summary.span: 在执行拖动操作期间发生。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 启动拖放操作时引发事件。The event is raised when a drag-and-drop operation is started. 事件允许拖动事件，以便为用户可视反馈提供拖放操作期间修改鼠标指针的外观的源。The event allows the source of a drag event to modify the appearance of the mouse pointer in order to give the user visual feedback during a drag-and-drop operation. 下面的备注描述如何以及何时引发与拖放操作相关的事件。The following remarks describe how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised. 方法确定当前光标位置下的项。The method determines the item under the current cursor location. 然后检查以查看项是否为有效的放置目标。It then checks to see if the item is a valid drop target. 如果项是有效的放置目标，产生指定的拖放效果引发事件。If the item is a valid drop target, the event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified. 有关拖放效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the enumeration. 按以下方式跟踪的更改的鼠标光标位置、 键盘状态和鼠标按钮状态：Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked in the following manner: - 如果用户移出一个窗口，则引发 事件。If the user moves out of a window, the event is raised. - 如果鼠标进入另一个项，引发该控件。If the mouse enters another item, the for that control is raised. - 如果鼠标移动但停留在同一个项，引发事件。If the mouse moves but stays within the same item, the event is raised. 如果键盘或鼠标按钮状态，更改事件引发，并确定是否继续拖动、 放置数据或取消该操作基于值属性的事件的。If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the property of the event's . 如果值是、引发事件以继续操作和产生新效果引发事件，从而能够设置适当的视觉反馈。If the value of is , the event is raised to continue the operation and the event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set. 有关有效放置效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of valid drop effects, see the enumeration. 和事件成对发生，以便当鼠标移到放置目标时，用户提供的最新反馈有关鼠标位置，如下所示：The and events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse's position, as follows: - 如果值是、 向源返回放置效果值，以便源应用程序可以执行适当的操作的源数据; 例如，如果会剪切数据是移动操作。If the value of is , the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果值是、引发事件。If the value of is , the event is raised. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在示例中，事件处理程序报告的匹配项事件。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报告可帮助您了解当发生事件，并可以帮助您进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告或频繁发生的事件上多个事件，请考虑替换与或追加到一个多行消息。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行此代码示例，请将其粘贴到包含从继承的类型的实例的项目，如或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后将其命名实例`ToolStripItem1`并确保与事件处理程序事件。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. remarks.format: ## Remarks ， ， ， ，和属性与图像处理的各个方面。The , , , , and properties pertain to various aspects of image handling. 使用中的映像控件通过设置这些属性直接或通过设置运行-– 仅限时间属性。Use images in controls by setting these properties directly or by setting the run-time–only property. 图像缩放由属性中的交互和、，如下所示：Image scaling is determined by the interaction of properties in both and , as follows: - 是所确定的最终图像的图像的组合按比例设置和容器的设置。 is the scale of the final image as determined by the combination of the image's setting and the container's setting. - 如果是`true`（默认值） 和是，会发生任何图像缩放，和大小是最大项或规定的最小大小。If is `true` (the default) and is , no image scaling occurs, and the size is that of the largest item, or a prescribed minimum size. - 如果是`false`和是，既不映像也不会进行缩放。If is `false` and is , neither image nor scaling occurs. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示， ， ，和属性。The following code example demonstrates the , , , and properties for a . 此示例摘自更大的示例中提供类概述。This example is part of a larger example available in the class overview. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在窗口消息预处理，以确定是否应经过预处理，或直接发送到给定的输入的字符过程中调用此方法。This method is called during window message preprocessing to determine whether the given input character should be preprocessed or sent directly to the . 如果方法返回`true`，指定的字符将直接发送到。If the method returns `true`, the specified character is sent directly to the . 但是，如果该方法返回`false`，字符被预处理并仅发送到如果它不使用预处理阶段时。However, if the method returns `false`, the character is preprocessed and only sent to the if it is not consumed by the preprocessing phase. 字符的预处理包括检查的字符是否另一个控件的助记键。The preprocessing of a character includes checking whether the character is a mnemonic of another control.

summary.span: 引发 AvailableChanged 事件。

span.span: Raises the AvailableChanged event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 引发事件时，将通过委托调用事件处理程序。Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. 有关详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). 方法还允许派生类对事件进行处理而不必附加委托。The method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. 这是在派生类中处理事件的首选技术。This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

para.span: 在重写在派生类中，一定要调用基类的方法，以便已注册的委托对事件进行接收。

span.span: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class’s method so that registered delegates receive the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在消息预处理以处理命令键过程中调用此方法。This method is called during message preprocessing to handle command keys. 命令键是始终优先于常规输入键的键。Command keys are keys that always take precedence over regular input keys. 命令键的示例包括快捷键和菜单快捷方式。Examples of command keys include accelerators and menu shortcuts. 该方法必须返回`true`以指示它已处理命令键，或`false`以指示该密钥不是命令键。The method must return `true` to indicate that it has processed the command key, or `false` to indicate that the key is not a command key. 基类实现方法返回`false`在所有情况下。The base-class implementation of method returns `false` in all cases.

para.span: 派生的类将很少，如果有，需要重写此方法。

in all cases.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法为项提供机会处理助记键字符。This method is called to give an item the opportunity to process a mnemonic character. 方法应确定项目是否处于处理助记键的状态，以及是否给定的字符是否表示助记键。The method should determine whether the item is in a state to process mnemonics and if whether the given character represents a mnemonic. 如果通过因此，此方法应执行与助记键并返回关联的操作`true`。If so, the method should perform the action associated with the mnemonic and return `true`. 如果不是，该方法应返回`false`。If not, the method should return `false`. 此基类实现依赖于主机控件才能调用方法来确定给定的字符是否匹配项的文本中助记键。This base-class implementation relies on the host control to call the method to determine whether the given character matches a mnemonic in the item's text. 在这种情况下，该方法将引发事件，并返回`true`。In this case, the method raises the event and returns `true`.

summary.span: 在拖放操作期间发生，并且允许拖动源确定是否应取消拖放操作。

span.span: Occurs during a drag-and-drop operation and allows the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 拖放操作期间键盘或鼠标按钮状态更改时引发事件。The event is raised when there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state during a drag-and-drop operation. 事件允许拖动源确定是否应取消拖放操作。The event allows the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled. 下面的备注描述如何以及何时引发与拖放操作相关的事件。The following remarks describe how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised. 方法确定当前光标位置下的项。The method determines the item under the current cursor location. 然后检查以查看项是否为有效的放置目标。It then checks to see if the item is a valid drop target. 如果项是有效的放置目标，产生指定的拖放效果引发事件。If the item is a valid drop target, the event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified. 有关拖放效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the enumeration. 按以下方式跟踪的更改的鼠标光标位置、 键盘状态和鼠标按钮状态：Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked in the following manner: - 如果用户移出一个窗口，则引发 事件。If the user moves out of a window, the event is raised. - 如果鼠标进入另一个项，引发该控件。If the mouse enters another item, the for that control is raised. - 如果鼠标移动但停留在同一个项，引发事件。If the mouse moves but stays within the same item, the event is raised. 如果键盘或鼠标按钮状态，更改事件引发，并确定是否继续拖动、 放置数据或取消该操作基于值属性的事件的。If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the property of the event's . 如果值是`Continue`、引发事件以继续操作和产生新效果引发事件，从而能够设置适当的视觉反馈。If the value of is `Continue`, the event is raised to continue the operation and the event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set. 有关有效放置效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of valid drop effects, see the enumeration. 和事件成对发生，以便当鼠标移到放置目标时，用户提供的最新反馈有关鼠标位置，如下所示：The and events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse's position, as follows: - 如果值是`Drop`、 向源返回放置效果值，以便源应用程序可以执行适当的操作的源数据; 例如，如果会剪切数据是移动操作。If the value of is `Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果值是`Cancel`、引发事件。If the value of is `Cancel`, the event is raised. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在示例中，事件处理程序报告的匹配项事件。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报告可帮助您了解当发生事件，并可以帮助您进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告或频繁发生的事件上多个事件，请考虑替换与或追加到一个多行消息。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行此代码示例，请将其粘贴到包含从继承的类型的实例的项目，如或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后将其命名实例`ToolStripItem1`并确保与事件处理程序事件。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event.
